text: Hempstead House, also known as the Gould-Guggenheim Estate or Sands Point Preserve is a large estate in Naussau County, New York. It was built for Howard Gould and later for Daniel Guggenheim. The building is like a castle.The architectural style is Late 19th and 20th Century Revivals. Several movies have been shot here. Examples include The Godfather (1972), Scent of a Woman (1992), Malcolm X (1992) and Great Expectations (1998). ==References== Category:Houses in the United States Category:Buildings and structures in New York (state)
title: Hempstead House
